description:
Beneath the Skin by Sandra Ireland
English | 2016 | Psychological Thriller | 1.2 MB


Taking a job in the studio of an Edinburgh taxidermist probably isnâ€™t Waltâ€™s wisest decision. Suffering from combat stress and struggling to outrun the demons from his past, he now finds himself confronted by the undead on a daily basis.
His enigmatic boss, Alys, and her sister, Mouse, have their own uneasy relationship with the past. Someone doesnâ€™t want to let them go. Can Walt save Mouseâ€™s eight-year-old son, William, from becoming the next victim? And can he save himself?
Deliciously disturbing, this psychological thriller peels back the skin of one modern family to reveal the wounds no one wants to see. It deals with the effects of trauma and how facing up to vulnerability is sometimes the only way to let go of the past.
